intro: Scleria rosea, commonly known as the pink-eyed grass, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grasses. The plant features slender, grass-like leaves and produces small, pinkish-white flowers clustered in dense spikes. Scleria rosea is characterized by its striking, showy inflorescences that give it a distinctive appearance. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
